author: @lindependant
title: Avec l'endométriose, un risque légèrement plus élevé de mourir précocément, selon une étude
text:
Avec l'endométriose, un risque légèrement plus élevé de mourir précocément, selon une étude
(AFP) - Les patientes atteintes d'endométriose ou de fibromes utérins ont un risque légèrement plus élevé de mourir avant 70 ans à cause de pathologies plus souvent présentes comme certains cancers, avance une vaste étude publiée jeudi.
"L'endométriose et les fibromes utérins (sont) associés, à long terme, à un plus gros risque de mortalité précoce", concluent les auteurs de l'étude publiée dans le BMJ.
Ce travail a été mené à partir d'une cohorte de femmes qui ont été régulièrement suivies pendant une trentaine d'années. Ce type d'étude, même s'il ne peut établir de cause à effet, est généralement d'une grande solidité.
Ici, il s'agit d'environ 100.000 infirmières américaines, dont l'état de santé a été mesuré tous les deux ans depuis 1989.
A partir de ces données, les chercheurs ont établi que les patientes atteintes d'endométriose et de fibromes utérins risquaient un peu plus souvent de décéder avant l'âge de 70 ans, seuil qu'ils définissent comme celui d'une mort précoce.
Ce risque s'explique par l'existence, déjà connue, de pathologies plus fréquemment associées à l'endométriose et aux fibromes utérins. Pour ces derniers, il s'agit essentiellement de certains cancers, tandis que pour l'endométriose, le panel de risques est plus large avec par exemple certaines maladies respiratoires.
Le risque de mourir tôt reste relativement faible pour les patientes. Pour l'endométriose, il est ainsi multiplié par 1,19 par rapport aux patientes qui ne sont pas atteintes par ces pathologies.
Mais les données soulignent l'importance de prendre en compte l'existence de ces troubles lors des examens de routine, par exemple menés par des médecins généralistes, soulignent les auteurs.
Ce travail s'inscrit dans un contexte où la santé féminine fait l'objet d'une plus grande attention de la part des chercheurs et des décideurs politiques.
C'est notamment le cas de l'endométriose, une maladie chronique qui touche environ une femme sur dix et se traduit habituellement par de fortes douleurs au moment des règles et/ou par des troubles de la fertilité.

author: José Arturo Cárdenas AFP
title: Bolivia risks debt default without new funding: president to AFP | National | foxbangor.com
text:
Bolivia, battling an economic crisis that has plunged it into social unrest, risks defaulting on its loan payments if it does not obtain new foreign financing, President Luis Arce told AFP on Wednesday.
"We are trying not to default. We have every intention of paying our debt, but if we don't have the resources?" the embattled leader said in an interview in his office in La Paz.
Bolivia's external debt stands at $13.3 billion.
Its main creditors are the Inter-American Development Bank, the Development Bank of Latin America and the Caribbean (CAF), the World Bank, and China.
Arce has been unable to convince parliament to allow him to seek new loans to the tune of $1.8 billion from multilateral agencies.
The country needs $2.6 billion by December for fuel imports and external debt payments.
"We are making the worst deal as a country. Because when one has external debt, you pay the principal and interest to the creditor, and that outflow of dollars is compensated by the inflow of new disbursements from new debts, which is not happening," said the president.
Bolivia's debt represents over 37 percent of its gross national income, according to the World Bank. The last time the country defaulted was in 1984.
Arce has dismissed calls to stand down over an economic crisis marked by a dire shortage of foreign currency, fuel and other basics.
But he has said he will not seek reelection in August, with his approval rating at 9.0 percent -- one of the lowest in South America, according to survey body Latinobarometro.
- 'All his artillery' - More from this section 'Second time I've died': Nobel laureate Jelinek denies death reports
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news

author: Dil Bar Irshad
title: Devotion Amidst Diversity: Good Friday 2024 Unites Christians Across India in Solemn Reflection
text:
On Good Friday 2024 , Christians throughout India gathered in cities like Mumbai, Vadodara, and New Delhi, observing the day with profound reverence through processions and re-enactments of Jesus Christ's 'way of the cross'. This day, rooted deeply in Christian faith, commemorates the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, marking a pivotal moment of reflection and prayer among the faithful. Amidst these solemn observances, concerns over violence against Christians in regions like Manipur were voiced, highlighting the day's contemporary relevance and the community's plea for peace and tolerance.
Advertisment Unity in Faith, Diversity in Expression In the heart of India's bustling metropolises and quiet towns, Good Friday brought together devotees from various denominations, showcasing the unity of faith against a tapestry of diverse cultural expressions. From the historical St. Joseph's Metropolitan Cathedral in Thiruvananthapuram to the streets of Kolkata, Christians engaged in heartfelt prayers, rituals, and processions. These observances not only honored the sacrifice of Jesus Christ but also echoed a collective call for harmony and understanding in a country as multifaceted as India.
Raising Voices Against Violence Advertisment Amidst the prayers and rituals, a poignant theme resonated - the concern for violence against Christians in parts of India, notably Manipur. Leaders and devotees alike emphasized the significance of Good Friday as a moment to advocate for peace and combat fear. Figures like Archbishop Thomas J Netto and Auxiliary Bishop Mar Thomas Tharayil, alongside political leaders such as Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan and Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, reflected on the teachings of Jesus Christ, urging for a world where love overcomes fear and division.
Global Significance, Local Reflection Good Friday's observances in India are a microcosm of the global Christian experience, where devotion and societal issues intersect. The day's events in India, from the silent processions to the solemn prayers, mirror the broader Christian engagement with contemporary societal challenges, demonstrating how faith can be a catalyst for change and a beacon of hope in times of turmoil. As Christians worldwide commemorated this sacred day, those in India added a unique voice, highlighting the power of faith in fostering societal harmony and understanding.
As the sun set on Good Friday 2024, the echoes of prayers and processions across India served as a reminder of the enduring spirit of faith amidst adversity. This day of solemn reflection not only brought together Christians across the nation in a shared observance but also cast a spotlight on the broader quest for peace and tolerance in society. Through their devout commemorations and calls for harmony, the Christian community in India has underscored the transformative power of faith

author: Douglas Dickie
title: Weather map shows five areas of Scotland to bask in 'Indian summer' within days - Aberdeen Live
text: Scotland is currently experiencing chilly conditions , with a blast of polar air expected to persist over the weekend. Snow is even forecasted to blanket northern parts of the country as the first signs of winter emerge. However, next week could bring a stark contrast in weather, with parts of Scotland set to bask in an 'Indian summer' . Weather maps indicate temperatures creeping into double figures across the nation. WXCharts has identified five areas where temperatures will soar around 50% above the October average. Thursday, October 17 is predicted to be the warmest day of the month, particularly in southern parts of the UK where temperatures could reach 20C. Even in Scotland, it will feel mild. Dundee is anticipated to be the hotspot with temperatures hitting 16C. And 15C will be experienced in the Dumfries and Galloway and Scottish Borders areas near the border with England. Aberdeen and Perthshire will also enjoy warmth with temperatures around 14 or 15C, reports the Scottish Daily Express . Thursday is also expected to be dry in the east of the country, according to WXCharts. While those five areas will be the hotspots, places like Edinburgh and East Lothian will also feel pleasant if the charts are accurate. The Cairngorms will be the coldest place in the UK, but even there temperatures will reach 10C, the average daytime temperature for October. The warmer conditions should persist into Friday before things return to normal for the weekend. Sign up for Aberdeen Live's newsletter Get all the latest Aberdeen news and headlines sent straight to your inbox by signing up to our free newsletter. From breaking news in and around the city, to traffic and travel and health , we've got you covered. The manually created newsletter arrives every day at around 4pm, giving you a round up of the most important stories we've covered that day. To sign up, simply click this link here . And if you aren't already, make sure you join the conversation over on our Facebook Groups and Aberdeen Live Instagram . In a separate forecast, the Met Office has predicted that "low pressure to the west will become increasingly influential" by the middle of next week. This could bring "an increased chance of rain, showers and perhaps strong winds, especially in the west or northwest". However, it does agree with WXCharts on the possibility of warmer weather, stating: "With winds from a southerly direction at first, temperatures will likely trend above average, with some warm conditions possible at times," before a return to cooler temperatures.

author: Arturo Perea
title: Cynthia Rodríguez revela si está lista para volver a la televisión
text: Desde hace unos años, [Cynthia Rodríguez se ha enfocado en formar una familia al lado de Carlos Rivera](https://www.quien.com/espectaculos/2024/02/27/cynthia-rodriguez-cuenta-detalles-hijo-carlos-rivera?utm_source=internal&utm_medium=link-recommended) y gracias a ello pudo cumplir su sueño de convertirse en mamá: en agosto del año pasado la pareja le dio la bienvenida a su primer hijo, León. Sin embargo, siempre se ha preocupado por no perder contacto con sus seguidores a través de sus redes sociales y constantemente comparte detalles de lo que sucede en su día a día, así como de los instantes más especiales de su vida personal, tal y como fue la llegada de su bebé y la maternidad.
